Antiviral drugs are believed to reduce disease severity and duration of infectiousness in individual patients, if taken sufficiently early (
9 ), and to protect contacts of infected persons, if taken prophylactically (
13
–
15 ). Some studies have suggested that aggressive treatment policies can effectively mitigate local transmission (
16 ,
17 ). In preparation for future influenza pandemics, the US Department of Health and Human Services therefore maintains a large Strategic National Stockpile (SNS) of antiviral drugs (
18 ), and most states include SNS antiviral drugs as a major component of their pandemic response plans (
19
–
22 ).
